name: Describes Correlation Structures
description: Describes the mathematical structures in prime coordinate space that support and enable non-local temporal correlations.
subject: urn:uor:resource:non-local-temporal-correlations
contextualDescription: The Non-Local Temporal Correlations resource describes the mathematical structures that enable non-local temporal effects, including prime coordinate temporal bundling that represents temporally separated events as unified patterns, temporal coherence manifolds forming higher-dimensional structures where events across time create coherent patterns, temporal loop structures forming closed loops through time, and mechanisms like temporal prime resonance, constraint satisfaction, and higher-dimensional projection.
